author: {'steamid': '76561198009613984', 'num_games_owned': 491, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1486850811}
review:
"A protagonist who reeks of perversion, since he's inherited his creators fetishes."

"Love at First Sight" Is a rather straightforward visual novel. Boy meets girl, girls bullied, they go through the stages of being friends and then romance. The charicters are well written, the art is well done save for a small lack of detail in a few scenes. The music fits rather well to boot. For a game made in two months due to procrastination and a deadline I think this speaks to about 98% of the clients playing it. It's a very good game with the amount of time it took to build it. Though I would love to see a patch where it adds all the things the author intended to be in the final cut.
For 10 dollars and the slightly short 3 hour playtime it's overpriced. Get it on sale but not for more than 50%. The creator disirves credit for all his work.

All in all you get a game with an engaging story and very well writing charicters. Though sad to say it has a lack of the common branching story line so its more like your reading a manga than playing a true visual novel. Grab it as you won't soon be forgeting the faceless protagonist and the one eyed beauty. (Oh yeah forgot to menton that) Or loudmouth, calm tom, ice stare lady, and shark toothed angry girl. You also won't forget the authors fetish for certain events that im not aposed to myself now that I'm typing it out.

"Wanna know how I got these scars?"
(Now imagine the Joker dressed in a schoolgirl outfit and Batman senpi is rubbing the scars with Joker shivering in his bat arms, blushing ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)

author: {'steamid': '76561198042373502', 'num_games_owned': 1345, 'num_reviews': 394, 'playtime_forever': 212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 212, 'last_played': 1483986176}
review:
[b]Туранга Лила. Мультипаспорт.[/b]

[i]Жил да был Фукунага Маморо. Замкнутый, необщительный и достаточно язвительный молодой человек, который старался не привлекать к себе внимания, ну а хобби его было весьма необычно – он преследовал одноглазую девушку с целью полюбить. Поначалу он дарил девушке подарки, кормил с рук, а затем начал трогать её многочисленные шрамы и говорить какая она милая и, скорей всего, глупо хихикать при этом… Вот честно, не этого я ожидал от данной игры. Ой, не этого.[/i]

Да, признаюсь, вступительное слово звучит крайне отталкивающе и те люди, что пишут восторженные оды, в адрес этой графической новеллы, могут возразить: «Ты все не так понял, это про любовь!» Возразить то можно всякое, вот только любви тут нет. Есть лишь нездоровые фетиши разработчика, кои он вынес на широкое обозрение. Фетиши, связанный с большими, очень большими глазами и шрамами. При этом он не пытается как-то завуалировать или отвлечь геймера от всего этого. Нас просто ставят перед фактом – у девочки, Усуи Сачи, один огромный глаз в пол лица, отсутствие носа и многочисленные шрамы по всему телу. Как и почему это произошло – не сообщается. Приведет ли это к неожиданному сюжетному повороту? Нет. Будет ли на этом акцентироваться внимание игрока? Постоянно. Опять же, можно возразить, дескать японцы любят все гипертрофировать, что их логика не похожа на нашу и прочее в том же духе. Конечно же, можно сказать что угодно, но правда в том, что подобный ход нельзя спрятать «под ковер» и сказать – ой, она плачет потому что не такая как все. А то что об этой девочке не судачит весь город и главный герой о ней услышал лишь тогда, когда столкнулся нос к носу это как бы не котируется. Про любовь ведь.

Ладно, хорошо, про любовь. Сосредоточим внимание на героях истории. Кто у нас есть? Клишированные донельзя образы – меланхоличный лучший друг героя, гиперактивная подруга, одноглазая девочка-стесняшка, школьная забияка и суровая тетя, которая пережила душевную травму потому она такая суровая. Ну прямо суповой набор. Не то чтобы это плохо, просто характеры именно что обозначены и сами персонажи говорят о себе – я плохой, я стеснительный, я злая. Обычно это сопровождается попыткой подтвердить это некими действиями, но подобное вызывает разве что скуку. Герои получились пустыми и они не вызывают той душевной отдачи, которую должны. Отсюда и история про любовь, что трещит по швам от странного, а порой и вовсе ненормального поведения главного героя, не захватывает. Играешь разве что на автомате, даже не затем, чтобы узнать чем дело закончится, финал угадывается задолго до этого, а просто потому что уже начал играть, не бросать же на полпути?

Итог? Графическая новелла, которая не способна заинтриговать и удержать внимание, даже несмотря на свою малую продолжительность. Единственное, что в ней есть, так это нездоровый фетиш на шрамы, который у автора сих строк вызвал отвращение. И ладно бы это было показано лишь единожды, но трижды! Нет, спасибо, я лучше пойду и поиграю во что-нибудь светлое, доброе, вечное. В «Witcher 3», к примеру. Там хоть не предлагают дотронуться до чужих шрамов… Wait! Oh shi~

3 из 10 фетишей

author: {'steamid': '76561198018893258', 'num_games_owned': 3719, 'num_reviews': 744, 'playtime_forever': 173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1482983646}
review:
ノベルゲーム。
主人公 福永護が単眼少女 臼井幸 にひと目惚れするところから始まるラブストーリーだ。単眼少女 臼井幸というキャラクターありきで作られたビジュアルノベルで選択肢はない。
開発経緯を全く知らなかった私にとってこのゲームを最初にプレイした印象は、単眼少女というのは身体上のなんらかの問題を抱えた少女を隠喩した表現で、インパクトを狙って付けられた設定、恋愛モノのひと目惚れに掛けて作られたとばかり思っていた。実際は違っていた。しかし、単眼少女をそのように置き換えても話の流れとしては何ら問題はない。傷だらけ(と傷フェチ)の設定は少し引っかかるが、割とオーソドックスな展開の恋愛話だ。

ありふれた話の流れではあるが、全体的に好意に溢れていて暖かい気持ちになれる良いノベルだと思う。残念なのはラストだ。話としては完結しているが余韻があまりないように思える。スタッフクレジットのBGMが他の場面で普通に使われてそうなものだったことで、ラストに唐突さもある。
それでも、丁寧にまとめられていることが感じられ、このゲームの最大の特徴である単眼少女というインパクトもある。単眼少女の眼力に惹き込まれたら、読んでみることをオススメする。

author: {'steamid': '76561198039562287', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1482830224}
review:
Let's start my rating for this game 6.8/10

Negitives:
  -  Generic/predictable story that rushed through some parts too quickly
  -  I suffered one game crash in my first 3 1/2 hours of game time making me play from a save from 20 minutes prior
  -  Black screens you need to click through
  -  The GUI was inconsistent within itself
  -  The music was repetitive and it wasn't unusual to loop through a track multiple times in one scene
  -  I had a few "who wrote this?" moments where dialog was awkward or an event that didn't make sense
  -  No dialog options
  -  One of the achievements requires you to play through the game in Japanese

Positives
 + Story was pretty cute
 + The artwork was incredible charming
 + Sachi was an adorable character
 + I got the game while it was on sale for $2.49

With all of the above put it mind It should shape up to a negitive review, but the game does carry the apeal through it's 3 1/2 hours even through it's flaws.  I have to recommend this game to people who are turned on by the art or if you just really like cyclopes ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)

author: {'steamid': '76561198115453571', 'num_games_owned': 462, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 2771, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1543538968}
review:
最初に言っておきますが、内容はナイです。
キャラクターはよくできてますがストーリーが分岐ナシの一本道で、中身もペラい。
にもかかわらず、作者自身が感じているように値段の設定が高すぎなので人によっては値段に見合った満足感を得られないかと思います。
が、それを帳消しにするくらいさっちゃんがカワイイ。
このコにハマれるヒトは値段に見合った満足感を間違えなく得ることができます。
また、余談ですが、このコによって単眼属性が付加される、ってワケではないようで、単眼云々抜きにしてさっちゃんのキャラクター性にハマるようにできているようです。
不思議な話ですが私には単眼属性は付加された形跡はナイです。

author: {'steamid': '76561198135088401', 'num_games_owned': 588, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 12056, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1649043510}
review:
ШЕДЕВР, купил по скидке за 62 рубля, пожалуй я не пожалел бы о покупке еслиб купил ее даже за полную цену, и даже дороже. Мне игра очень понравилась, и впала в душу, пожалуй на долго.
Рисовка у игры не обычная, немного депрессивная, но при этом плавная и красивая, у игры есть своя атмосфера, персонажей в игре не много, но это не делает ее менее интересной, даже наоборот, позволяет лучше узнать характер персонажей. Сценарий короткий, игру прошел за полтора часа (Остальное время смотрел картинки в папке экста, и фарми л карточки), оболочка сюжета не блещет уникальностью, но это не делает его скучным. Игра хоть и линейная, но это ни чуть не раздражает ( Тот же БЛ, игра не линейная но Семен часто тупил и вел себя как счастливый обладатель лишней хромосомы).
В общем итог - Игру ОЧЕНЬ рекомендую всем, особенно ценителем аниме, плюс в придачу получите новый фетиш (Как увидите главною героиню, поймете о чем я ), игра стоит своих денег, а со скидкой вообще грех не взять.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993391011', 'num_games_owned': 627, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1482673972}

author: {'steamid': '76561198049224456', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 444, 'last_played': 1482623992}
review:
First things first, this game is not worth ten dollars, if it's on sell then it's worth it, it's really good, cute, heartwarming, and overall a good experience, though it's a kinetic novel (which means there's zero choices in the game) it still felt like a proper VN.

The fetishes that are very clearly displayed, didn't feel intrusive and were overall cute and endearing, if you're okay with a scar, feeding others your own food, and your girl getting punched (there is no actual scene of her getting punched but it was in dialog and it wasn't in a sexual way either) fetishes then this will be just fine for you too as it was for me.

Now onto what it's about.
You're just some dude who meets this cyclops girl and she's cute and you fell in love with her at first sight of course, if you can't tell that from the name and pictures then you must be some kind of airhead, like a certain character from this game.

Now the flaws.
1. The music can be pretty bad at times though intentionally, I know this will be annoying to others but I was fine with it since I knew it was trying to portray a sort of off kilter and creepy (not scary creepy) vibe.

2. The little cinemas where they tell you what act you're on are tween animated (look it up) though it's not too bad at times, at other times it makes me want to die a little since it's kinda cringy.

3. No choices, this really sucked since I wanted a route without the fetish parts so the ending would have them be less close (Neutral end), a route where you'd abuse her yourself (bad end), or even a route where she's a masochist and you're a sadist or something (true end perhaps) since she did seem like the masochist type.

[b]Overall I loved it and it tugged on my weeaboo heart strings but it's only worth it if it's under six dollars.[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198326213075', 'num_games_owned': 648, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 441, 'last_played': 1481077126}
review:
[h1]Graphics are noticeable, narration results a bit monocled.[/h1]

I do not recommend this game as in my opinion it is lacking content and some events are resulting slightly rushed.
Dialogues result too simple, characters are actually nice but lack personality and seem to be pushed forcibly in the story.

The story is a generic romantic encounter between a boy and a... wait wha, a cyclops...!
Besides the plot lacking events, what seemed out of place in this game to me is how plain our main heroine is presented; a silent non reactive shy girl having a single eye (with no utter explanation to it, nor affecting particularly the main story) being bullied. After -obviously- getting noticed by senpai, she starts opening up bit by bit, et cetera, et cetera.
So the only "particular" trait of her would be her eye and wounds presented upon her sprites which lack background story.

I am not understating the developer's work and time put in this game. Actually, the art is quite interesting and particular (mostly appreciated the background art!), music is just right at the point. 
[i]What makes this game too ordinary is not the fact of it being a Kinetic Novel.[/i]
It may need some retouches as the developer noticed themselves, but its basics might create a good starting point.
I purchased Hitomebore during sales and honestly if I were to pay 10$ for this game I'd end up being disappointed.

[b]What you can find in this game:[/b][list]    
    [*]Nice bgm and art
    [*]Gloomy atmosphere (with no real plot twists)
    [*]Romance
    [*]Unusual fetishes
    [*]Cyclops heroine
    [*]Cute outfits
    [*]Yummy food[/list]
[b]Absence of:[/b][list]
    [*]Horror
    [*]Violent scenes
    [*]Creepy background story
    [*]Interesting monster characters
    [*]Serious plot[/list]

Autistic screeching/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198192596818', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 478, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 478, 'last_played': 1477110469}
review:
爱，是什么呢？你相信一见钟情吗？
我反正是相信的。
诚然，时间是在爱情实践中必不可少的要素。但是那种一见钟情的灵感瞬间，正是燎原的星星之火。
特别是，坐在天台楼梯间的那个少女，只有一只眼睛。
只有一只巨大的眼睛，长在她的额头正下方。
这无疑是一种缺陷。
那是你看见她一瞬间之内就立马明白的事。
但还有一些事你要一点时间才能明白，她因为她的缺陷而痛苦不堪。她可能也对生活抱有很多幻想，但却微妙的明白她的幻想不可能成为真实。她可能经常会哭。然后你隐约意识到，她所遭遇的隔离和偏见是不公平的，为了公平起见，你想去带她认识真正美好的世界应该有的模样，生活应该如何。还有一个人应该如何坚强。
剩下来的事情啊，你要用更多的时间才会明白了。
你想到自己，你想到自己的失意与幻灭，你想到自己的软弱与缺陷。
越是想到这些，你就越想拉起她的手，帮她站起来。越是想到这些，你就越是感到她的痛苦的深刻。你越是感到，你和她，在外表上是多么不同，而在灵魂上是多么相似啊。 
而外表上的不同无关紧要，重要的是你充分意识到，她和你是同一族类，她和你是相似的人。
她是可爱的人。这是你最后意识到的事。
然后就只有爱有关系了。
所以你喜欢抚摸她手上的伤痕，就好像抚摸着自己手上的伤痕。
所以你在无意中戳到她的痛处的时候，其实你自己的内心比她还要痛苦。
什么是爱？
这就是爱。

author: {'steamid': '76561198079608950', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1480128505}
review:
Although in his message within the Extras, the author claims he had to cut a lot of ideas for time and that he's disappointed with the final product, I feel as though it is perfect just the way it is. The short run time makes it less intimidating than some other visual novels, which - between a million characters, branching paths, and different endings - can be a bit overwhelming, especially if all I want to do is relax. This game is not only soothing and heartwarming, it's also very sincere in its depiction of personal issues, from bullying to poor communication within a family. The characters were charming, the art style unique (a refreshing blend of dark yet whimsical), and the background music hit that sweet spot of good but not distracting.
If you're looking for something easy to get into but hard to put down, this is the title that will sate you, and you won't have to feel guilty if you end up playing the whole thing in one sitting.
In my opinion, a perfect kinetic novel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198313315301', 'num_games_owned': 277, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 573, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 569, 'last_played': 1558410259}
review:
业界清流，可惜没有汉化，难以安利
其实本来就是个无法安利的小众游戏
我还是清楚的
画风本来就不算主流，希尔薇一开始也用画风劝退了不少人
再加上没有中文，剩下来的除了猎奇就只有特别喜欢独眼娘的人了
各种游戏网站上对这个游戏的介绍，基本围绕着一个核心，那就是《Teaching Feeling》这款游戏
要么是说“和《希尔薇》是同一个作者”，要么就是拿两个游戏做对比
我见过最夸张的一个介绍，说《一目倾心》是《希尔薇》的正统续作，差点笑死在街上
这游戏注定只能一个人玩，然后一个人萌上独眼
不要再想安利了，难度比安利《一拳原作版》还高，不要问我经历了什么

以上 2016年11月24日
以下 2018年6月25日

很高兴现在这游戏有这么多人发现了
也有了dalao做了汉化
（虽然已经连英语生肉都快啃完了2333

但是往下一翻评测
完 全 意 料 之 内
很多都拿本作与《TeachingFeeling》对比
甚至还有完全没提到本作的
难道Ray-Kbys只有《TeachingFeeling》一个作品吗？
还是说这么多人的大脑只能装一个游戏？
不要再用两个类别不同的游戏作无谓的对比了，请
（突然兴奋的患者.jpg

觉得评测里提到《TeachingFeeling》本身根本就不是什么问题
甚至可以聊聊Ray-Kbys（预定）的新作品咕
比如期待已久的《ButterflyAffection》（蝴蝶情缘）或者《LonelyOnly》之类的

但是通篇都只有“这游戏没希尔薇好”或者甚至就是完全只提到《TeachingFeeling》的
就很失礼[spoiler]  人间之屑  [/spoiler]了（愤慨

以下2018年11月27日

看到现在评测里有越来越多的人
开始发现到臼井幸的可爱之处了wwwwww
甚至还有专门的wiki&百科词条了
[spoiler]  好日子来临了！（兴奋）  [/spoiler]
那么《LonelyOnly》不知道什么时候有后续呢？[spoiler]  已经在做了.jpg  [/spoiler]
顺便说一下，臼井幸在Twitter上有bot账号的→@Satsi_Usui

author: {'steamid': '76561198054070523', 'num_games_owned': 198, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1463387748}
review: When I first saw this game it had the art style of another visual novel called "Teaching Feeling" (at least I think that's the name) so I decided to buy it. I thought it was going to be longer, and I was going to have actual choices, but I still loved it! It's a extremely cute high school love story, though the part with the bully could have used some TLC, I still feel it helped move the story in a good way. Overall, if you want to be told a love story, then this is the VN for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067356672', 'num_games_owned': 573, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 360, 'last_played': 1462073919}
review:
这款游戏的作者相信大家一定不会陌生，Ray-kbys，TeachFeeling这款纯爱神作就是出自他手。我相信如果有一天TF能登入steam就算只能摸头买衣服也一定会热销。Love at first sight在贴吧已经有人在组织汉化了，暂定名为一目钟情，各位可以去关注一下。简单来说，这款游戏还是R大的一贯作风，满满的纯爱
 - 女主角固有能力：被攻击时有一定概率被击飞
 - 男主角固有能力：绝对能接住被击飞的女主

author: {'steamid': '76561198098762030', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1478714015}
review:
A lot of people say this game ain't worth $10 USD. They aren't wrong.
So why did I buy it at full price?
ray-k's works are some of my favorite so I (hoped)wanted to support him.
And he hits some of my niches.
Plus I already own the other Visual Novel he has that will never come to Steam since a patch ain't gonna make that thing not R-18 and worth more or less $10 USD with said near impossible patch.
But I've been wrong before and can kinda hope.
Still a nice read with a nice character. 
You should get it on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054197515', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 411, 'last_played': 1480037481}
review:
很早就拿到全成就了，今天过来补一篇评测。这游戏的译名我都想好了，叫《一眼钟情》。

+有趣 [spoiler] 猎奇？ [/spoiler]的设定
+感人的情节

不过本人玩的时候全程自己配音，嗯，真带感！

PS：从来没想过一只眼的女主也能这么萌。

9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198017961272', 'num_games_owned': 785, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 279, 'last_played': 1476761422}
review:
You could guess how the game is gonna go from the title alone. What you see is what you get, and that's not necessarily a bad thing. A very comfy game with a simple plot that's enjoyable throughout

The Good:
-Good artstyle
-Fun writing
-Very relaxing soundtrack

The Bad:
-Not a lot of animation. Expect to see characters in the same pose most of the time. Quite disappointing, since the between-chapters cutscenes have really nice animation to them.
-Characters are somewhat cliche and adhere to archetypes. There's the kooky friend, the quiet one, the bully, etc.
-No branching paths. The story is entirely linear.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996887052', 'num_games_owned': 2308, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1476371063}
review:
This is a bit of a sideways thumb case.

CON: Pretty cliche characters and story, really. Other than the "one eye" thing, the love interest is a pretty generic bullied weakling. This VN has no choices, so it's one straight path through. You get a glimpse at the author's scar fetish.

PRO: Cliche, but likeable enough characters. This seems to have been 90% the work of one guy for whom this was his first VN effort done under a time crunch, and for that it comes out pretty decently. Upon finishing the main story there are some interesting behind-the-scenes extras.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996457595', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 374, 'last_played': 1472361219}
review:
Quiet, Shy, Awkward, Petite, Cute, Cyclops

All words to describe the adorable Sachi, the main love interest of the story.

The setting didn't change much, mostly taking place in a school setting with some events occurring in other locations.
The cast is small, but the characters each are defined with their own unique personalities.

The story is linear, so no choices or alternate endings to be found here.

Still, I couldn't help but fall in love with the characters, and I could easily see myself in the shoes of the main protagonist.
The origin of the single-eyed girl is never fully explained but by the end of the story, it didn't matter to me. Which I think was part of the writers intention, we should learn to accept things, not question them, no matter how odd or out of place they seem.

Dare I say this... I would accept Sachi as my waifu. [i](She's so CUTE!)[/i]
And i would even touch her scars.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106576815', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1473206978}
review:
This is one of those times where the reviewer starts off with letting you know that they don't fully recommend a "game". I recommend it, but it is so short and fairly empty to where I cannot recommend it while it is $10. A decent sale makes it worth it for me. Also, this review will not use what I consider spoilers (which I use fairly broadly), since I know how big of a deal hearing something in context and for the first time can be. This review uses impressions and general statements of the product.

The story is good, and I found myself caring for some of the characters. The character develpment (what I consider the most essential part to a story) is good, but is quite rushed. There are only a few real characters in the story, and the world feels fairly emtpy outside of their thoughts and interactions with each other. They don't all have much direct explanation of their backgrounds, with most development coming from a scenic style of writing. For those who are pretentious enough, or unfortunate enough to know what that means, you know that its where the characters primarily express themselves through the context of a scene. This lets you read into their character from their direct parts, rather than necessarily just being told what to think. There are parts where they will tell you mostly of how to think of the characters, but the real thing is that there doesn't seem to be a world that the characters are in, rather some inconceivable void past the tinges of a world at the edges of your vision.

After all fo the halabaloo, it has good writing, but not much of it. I would recommend purchasing it for the sensations it brings, and supporting the writer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115938132', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1473577128}
review:
This is actually a great game in my personal opinion. Even though the creator has rushed some of the content he formally put a apollogy with in the extra tab of the game and gave us his small journey and story of his creation. My focus was the story of the game at first, it was going well till chapter 3 and the visual novel itself started to lose touch with me the reader a bit (opinion) but thankfully brought me back when switching stories of another characters perspective witch enhanced more insight of the situations at hand. Though the story was singled path only it made me the reader very happy to see a more wider depth story to only 2 charcters that shouldn't have met regurley and more than that loved one another despite the obviouse diffrences in backgrounds and social apperance. This maybe a flawed game but thanks to the flaws it makes this game great (opinion). Hopefully the Author of this game reads this to know this is a beautifull piece of art he has created and even one day can make so much more of this great story flourish.
My personal opinion of this game 4/5.
I hope you continue this story I personally think the end was not truly the end.
Thank you for reading and give this visual novel game a chance it truly is a work of art.

author: {'steamid': '76561198170893570', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1470807669}
review:
Overall, Love at First Sight is a very good dose of meet cute. The artwork is quite nice, blending elements that wouldn't be out of place in a horror game (gloomy color palette,  sagging eyes, etc.) with typical visual novel trappings (huge eyes--or rather, eye, effusive poses, and a surprising amount of moe).

Those seeking a particularly deep story should probably go elsewhere. While LaFS is very, very cute and can bring the feels when needed, at the end of it all it's nothing more than (particularly sweet) fluff. 

LaFS is also very short. While I am a quick reader, I was able to finish the game within a few hours even with a bit of idle time. Because of this, I can only recommend getting this game on sale--it's overpriced as-is.

Final Score: 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198073558594', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 234, 'last_played': 1471216779}
review:
/!\ Attention /!\ : Ce jeu n'est pas un Visual novel "standard" (comme je le pensais avant d'y jouer) : il n'y a aucune interaction possible donc aucun gameplay.On ne fait que lire, pour autant je n'en suis pas du tout deçu, au contraire, les images et les musiques apportent un petit quelque chose non negligable.

Les personnages sont très attachant, ils sont assez develloper pour etre interessant suivant leurs importance dans l'histoire.
Les passages animer sont très sympathique.

Seul bémols le peut de musiques et de plan de fond.

En bref: avec quelque defaut j'en suis quand meme satisfait, meme si la durée de vie du jeu est très courte le jeu reste bon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044923847', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1677649893}
review:
Amazing visual novel! Beat the game in 2.6 hours at an enjoyable speed and got 11/12 achievements with the last one beating the game in Japanese which I do not read so why would I do this.

The game or well story is very cute and sweet overall with lots of times when you think it is going to take a terrible turn or something freaky is going to happen. Let's say it's a 10/10 for keeping your interest.

After finishing the game in the extras I completely loved the authors comments and game making diary. His passion for wanting to turn some drawings into a story for a manga and game let me connect with him and see his vision. He apologizes for not being good enough, when I think what he made was terrific and took lot's of hard work, love and dedication to characters he's flushed out well. 

The characters feel real and you get the sense they are not just placed into the game without real thought put into who they are, why they are there and how they act, feel and speak. 

I don't tend to write positive only reviews on games (Check my other ones), but this game made me happy! I loved the characters, the music, the art, the concept and think the author did a great job.

For me and IMO 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198076904436', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 344, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 333, 'last_played': 1647827728}
review:
Love at First Sight is a visual novel based around the main character slowly falling in love with a girl, who happens to have a singular large eyeball instead of the usual two. It is essentially, a simple love story minus the depth and complexity that most novels have.

First things first, I like the art style – it has that indie vibe that makes it stands out. It’s not over-the-top beautifully wonderful that make your eyes moist – but it works nonetheless. Thumbs up!

Unfortunately the music is, for the most part, colourless. There are a couple of songs that are passable, but all of the tracks repeat themselves too often, so it’s better played with the volume on low. Thumbs down.

Now for the main story. It’s… barely above average I guess. There’s just no real ‘meat’ to it. For me, a visual novel (or any game for that matter) needs to either be entertaining, exciting, original, funny, shocking, or at the very least, somewhat interesting – and sadly, Love at First Sight scarcely delivers in a couple of those categories.

Overall, if you’re a heavy fan of visual novels, and see this one on a sale, than maybe this will be for you. It’s okay for light reading and, well, it DOES have a cute girl with one eye. Just don’t expect too much.

Score: 59/100

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198094013316', 'num_games_owned': 360, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1471631722}
review:
[h1]Protect That Smile: Scarred Cyclops Edition[/h1]

Honestly, this VN isn't bad, it just isn't good either. Story wise, it failed to offer a structure or development unique to the typical high school romantic drama (i.e. no plot twists, little to no mystery, cliche character development, etc.). Basically, the story was:[spoiler]
1. Go to school
2. Talk to friends about the shy girl
3. Talk to the shy girl
4. You and the shy girl grow slightly closer
5. Repeat steps 1-4 until you fall in love with her
6. End
[/spoiler]

If you want a good high school romantic drama (i.e. has unique story/character elements): [list]
[*] Play [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/324160/]Clannad[/url] or watch [url=http://myanimelist.net/anime/4181/Clannad__After_Story]Clannad: After Story[/url]
[*] Read or watch [url=http://myanimelist.net/anime/30015/ReLIFE?q=relife]ReLIFE[/url]
[*] Watch [url=http://myanimelist.net/anime/9989/Ano_Hi_Mita_Hana_no_Namae_wo_Bokutachi_wa_Mada_Shiranai?q=anohana]Anohana[/url]
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561198073745147', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 521, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 521, 'last_played': 1469512295}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025146025', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 253, 'last_played': 1468933274}
review:
100% a one-track visual novel, there's literally no way to lose, and there's no choices to be made. Sit back and watch the story go because that's basically all you can do. 
That doesn't really kill the charm though. The characters are fairly well written, as are their lines, and I personally like that there's no voice acting. 
The music can get really monotonous, fair warning.
It's a nice little game for the feels, and if you don't like cyclops girls now, you likely will by the end of this game. (Unless of course you hate the character archetype the cyclops girl is given.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198006413390', 'num_games_owned': 3172, 'num_reviews': 214, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 145, 'last_played': 1491222266}
review:
This is a short kinetic visual novel about a student Fukunaga Mamoru who recently transferred to a different high school and came to meet a girl with one eye in a different class Usui Sachi. Over seven acts, Mamoru will interact with Sachi, his classmates and friends Akemi and Tomoyori, Sachi's aunt Mayumi, Sachi's classmate Rui and Mamoru's mother as a minor supporting character.

Although there are no choices to make at all in this game, the CG, soundtracks, and overall game presentation are nicely done. The story and plot is written like a romantic comedy and has a nice happy ending. Reading through the storyline and dialogue, unlocking all extra content and obtaining all achievements will take less than 10 hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198220372059', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 493, 'last_played': 1468741694}

review:
Besides being adorable it is particularly relatable. 

It reminds me very much of dating my wife who came from far more humble beginnings than myself, kind of like Sachi(the cyclops girl)

It really hits home in her constant feelings of undeserving and comfort coming from the protagonist.

Particularly heartwarming. I'd like to thank the author for creating it. Brings back a lot of memories, bad and good but much like the game we're in it for the long haul now ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198055089474', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 234, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1468050981}
review:

The game features no choices or interactivity beyond clicking for the next piece of dialogue. The music is okay and the story is honestly not long enough and doesn't feel properly finished. That being said the art is really great and I love the style.

Overall, actually quite enjoyable if you like a cute short story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106936984', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1504999938}
review:
Okay now. I have never written a review before so bare with me on this.
Pros:
Good Story
Interesting Artsyle
Characters are Likeable

Cons:
No choices (Just reading dialogue. Not bad per se, but variety is the spice of life.)
Music isn't anything to write home about (Save one or two tracks.)
Relatively short

I got this game on a whim and stayed for to look through all the extra content and was genuinely interested in the game's development. I wasn't expecting much honestly but it delivered a lot.

The story is standard but it is told in a way that makes it enjoyable and when backed by the artstyle it evokes emotion from the characters and the player. When a game makes me feel dread or joy, I know its doing something right.

As for the characters, they're likeable and funny. especially if you go to the extras in game. You'll see what I am talking about if you get this game.

Now the game only lasts for a approximately half a day. Which is pretty good for a few people. But seeing as it was only done by a few guys, it suffers from a lack of music variety and no choices to choose how the player interacts with the other characters.

Despite the flaws its well worth the $9.99 price tag. With a 1 being terrible, a 5 being average, and a 10 being perfect.
I give it a 8/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198161543301', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 223, 'last_played': 1467692909}
review:
Sachi is your typical one-eyed girl next door that you've always had a crush on... 
Wait, one-eyed girl?

This short visual novel describes a slice of life scenario where a young man, Mamoru, falls in love with the moderately-bruised Sachi, who only longs to have a smile worthy of the name her parents gave her (sorry Grisaia!) There really is nothing that stands out too much in this VN:  Boy falls in love with girl, girl reciprocates, they date, she meets his friends, he meets her relative, girl learns to stand up for herself... everything here is something anyone over 15-18 has already seen or experienced, whether first hand experience or through an entertainment medium.  

The story doesn't overstay its welcome, though it'd have been worthwhile if we could have had more unique scenarios. Backgrounds are heavily reused, there aren't a lot of variety to sprites, characters are not voiced.  BUT despite these flaws (if you would call them that), the entire story is a warm, feel-good experience.  Characters have well-defined, one-dimensionsal personalities, but Sachi especially exhibits some growth, which is nice to see.  Though initially weak and spineless, Sachi is likeable and it's fun seeing her mature overly the course of the story.  Sachi's eye is initially viewed as something to be embarassed about, but Mamoru is not repulsed, or even attracted, by this unique aspect.  The eye isn't a big problem; very little about the story would be changed even if Sachi had two eyes. It differentiates Sachi but doesn't define her.  -------> [Good moral to glean]

To sum it up, the story/art is pretty generic, but it'll make you feel good inside.  It's worth a read or two.  

I'd recommend this to anyone with a few hours to kill, or as an intro to a VN rookie.

author: {'steamid': '76561198171173455', 'num_games_owned': 293, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1488631177}
review:
簡単にいえば、単眼っ子と学園生活の中で仲良くなっていちゃつくゲームです。
あぁ！待って待って！、「単眼はちょっと・・・」なんて言わないで！まずは偏見を捨てて純粋に聞いて！

自分も属性としては単眼はあんまり・・・ってクチだったのですが、このゲームをプレイする事で逆に好きになりました。
それも単眼っ子といっても本当に控えめな小動物みたいで、見ているだけで守ってあげたくなるような可愛い女の子です。
実際プレイしてると「あぁ・・・こんな子が彼女になんねぇかな」って気持ちになりますし、単眼という一見最初はデメリットに見えた特徴が
だんだんと愛らしく見えてきて、まさしく「ひと目惚れ」してしまいます。
恋愛ゲーといってもノベルゲーなので選択肢はないのですがそこは別に自分としては気にするポイントにはなりませんでした。
是非、単眼っ子はちょっとなぁ・・・という人も値段もそんなに高くもないのでプレイしてみるのをオススメします。
では改めてこのゲームをギフトしてくれたフレンドよ、ありがとう。

ここからは雑談で
僕はTeaching Feelingというアダルトゲームから作者の事を知っていて個人的には大好きな絵柄という事で気に入っていて、
そこから作品を追う感じでsteamでこのゲーム見つけプレイしたクチなのですが、
この作者、非常に偏った属性というか欠損など、一般の方々からは引かれやすい趣向を持っているのですが、それと同時にその属性を非常に魅力的に見せる上に、可愛らしいキャラ付けをするという事がとても上手いです。
Twitterやpixivで新しい作品が出るたびに、まるで新しい属性に目覚めるようです。
Ray-Kと検索すれば出てくる筈なので是非作品を見てみては如何でしょうか。
あとTeaching Feelingという奴隷少女と生活するゲームもDMMで週間1位を何週間も独占したことがある上、頻繁にアップデートが行われていて良い作品なのでそちらもオススメします。

author: {'steamid': '76561198146200909', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 482, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 482, 'last_played': 1467515332}
review:
“I'm Not Crying, There's Something In My Eye”
This game is truly a comforting one. 
A heartwarming tale that only you, and eye can see where true love rests.
Scars of painful memories will always heal when better memories are made.
Fetishes are good too. If only this was given much more content.
I recommend for the visual novel reading audience.
Sure it could've been better, but for what it is worth and under its time constraints, I love it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198162703817', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1467152179}
review:
I bought this game because of the store pic.

Thought it looked interesting, and after beating the game, my opinion hasn't changed. Plot revolves around the protagonist falling in love with a cyclops, who's shy and has been bullied because of her condition. His two friends help him out a little bit after he gets closer to her, and they all become good friends in the end. I really felt that the protagonist was a bit too forward and chatty.

He kept asking all of these questions, in his attempts to be friends with the cyclops, that it came off as cringey to me. It toned down in the later acts, but still, it was awkward and weird. Especially since his friend, Akemi, is supposed to be the chatterbox in the group.

The acts felt short to me, but surprisingly, I managed to finish the game in about two hours. The extras unlocked after beating the game is pretty interesting, as the developer revealed he had time constraints when making this game, and thought about making it a doujinshi.

Which, for those that don't know, is a manga. I highly recommend going through all the extra content after finishing the game, and viewing the epilogue scenes. I don't really have anything bad to say about the game, since this was made during time constraints, but I would like to say that I'll be supporting any future releases by the dev, who made a great game.

Thought the transitions where you had to press enter several times, and going from classroom to the halls, was pretty cute and immersive. I can see some people finding that off-putting though, but regardless, and like most games, it's all up to preference.

Oh, and the game is more of a kinetic novel than anything, which doesn't have choices.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993219560', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1466913456}
review:
I RECOMMEND THIS VISUAL NOVEL! (THIS IS NOT A GAME)
Ray Days (Also known as Creepy Cute and Freakily Charming) makes fantastic art, story and games. While everything is related to visual novels or visual novel games (cause there is a difference) this right here is NOT A GAME.

However. I enjoyed everything. He does what I have not seen many manage to do with me, and thats to feel for something right away. Its a story about how people who are different are treated within the school system (as in fellow class mates and such) and how much that can fuck up their life (And I can relate on 2 of the 3 ends of what this visual novel shows. The Bullied and the one trying to stop the bullying)

Ray Days might be my biggest weakness when it comes to games and novels, and I am amazed by that, cause everything he does feels close to home for me.

Do I recommend it? YES... YES I DO... FUCKING BUY THIS!

author: {'steamid': '76561198152343331', 'num_games_owned': 287, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 627, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1548503691}
review:
[h1] << Love at First Sight / Фетишизм по шрамам...? >> [/h1]

[h1] Сюжет: [/h1]

Визуальная новелла относительно небольшого размера (примерно 4-5 часов чтения), повествующая о девочке со странным физиологическим отклонением, недавно переведённом в новую школу парне, и о их отношениях друг с другом. Изначально, новелла предстаёт заурядной повседневностью, если бы не одно "но" - главная героиня. Основное повествование идёт от того самого парнишки, но иногда, повествователь будет меняться, дабы рассмотреть определённую ситуацию с разных сторон. Новелла является кинетической, а значит, будет иметь линейный сюжет. По конкретике всё, перейдём к личному мнению.
 
[h1] Мнение о новелле (Warning! Возможны спойлеры!): [/h1]

Немного абстрагированный главный герой, новая внешняя среда, парочка близких друзей... Вроде бы, обычный такой сюжетик для повседневности. Однако, наличие центральной персоны - одноглазой девушки всё в корне меняет (только я один вспомнил одноглазую из "Meridian 113" ?). Само её наличие вряд ли кого-то удивит (ну, MonsterGirls, у них как бы фанаты есть даже), а вот отношение к ней главного героя... Это что-то странное... Не знаю почему, но лично у меня наблюдение за их отношениями вызывало какой-то дискомфорт. Все эти просьбы и потрагивания шрамов, чуть ли не ритуальное отношение к ним... Бр-р-р. Это как... Ханако рут на максималках из новеллы "Katawa Shoujo", только там это выглядит мило, а тут... просто странно? Я, наверное, слишком много раз сказал слово "странно", но это самое точное слово к данной новелле. Однако, повторюсь, если абстрагироваться от наличия главной героини, то это самая обычная новелла, со слабопроработанными второстепенными персонажами и заурядной завязкой сюжета. Но, как сам автор высказался в комментариях к своей новелле, которые он оставил в пункте "экстра", он очень хотел передать характер главной героини... Полагаю, ему это удалось (а ещё он хотел, чтобы сюжет был более проработанным и нелинейным, но с этим вышел трабл). Вообще, в пункте "экстра" очень много разных подпунктов: описание персонажей, послесловие от автора, отдельные сцены, подробности создания самой новеллы. Прям видно, что разработчик общался с людьми, ожидающими появления игры в ходе разработки, делился мыслями, концептами, прислушивался к пожеланиям. Это довольно редко встречается, поэтому отдельный плюс разработчику. Более этого, сказать что-то сложно, поэтому, перейдем к деталям.

[h1] Далее в деталях: [/h1]

Визуально, как можно заметить, всё выглядит, по крайне мере, нарисованным (в кой-то веке, фоны - это не содранные фотографии, которые просто замылили. Но, если брать конктретно, то лично мне такой стиль не очень нравится, хотя, наверное потому, что выглядит для меня необычно? А ещё, моё любимое - черные полосы по бокам экрана... 
При этом, в новелле присутствуют CG арты (11 штук) и анимированные сцены, что встречается довольно редко (хотя, это всё же платная новелла).

Музыкальное сопровождение, состоявшее из 8 треков поддерживало атмосферу повседневности и особо никак не выделялось. Однако, это оригинальный саундтрек, написанный специально для данной новеллы, что заслуживает отдельного уважения.
 
[h1] Итог: [/h1]

Подводя итог, сложно определится с оценкой для новеллы. Возможно, из-за личных предпочтений, сюжет новеллы мне не пришёлся по вкусу (не фанат MonsterGirls), но при этом, я вижу старания разработчика над новеллой, которую он делал фактически в одиночку. Поэтому... Я всё же склоняюсь к тому, что новелла более-менее стоит своих денег и заслуживает одобрения с выборочной рекомендацией к прочтению.
P.S. Потребуется русификатор.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116496800', 'num_games_owned': 190, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1465029883}
review:
Что точно могу сказать про "Love ar First Sight", то, что она не стоит тех денег, которые за нее просят. Покупая игру, заинтересовала оболочка: О, одноглазая девочка, значит там должно быть что-то интересное, мистическое, чего ранее в новеллах видеть не доводилось? И что же получаем в итоге? Типичную историю, непонятно чем мотивированное желание парня общаться с убогим человеком, с которым их не объединяет ничего общего, ведь она по сути РОСТОК. Безхарактерный персонаж, на которого не интересно смотреть, от которого не слышишь ничего кроме: прости/извини/неловко.
Друзья ГГ так же ничем не примечательны. Все стандартно, шутки не вызывают улыбку, декорации прорисованы слабенько, музыкальное соопровождение: один звук повторяется и повторяется и повторяется, сменяется другим звуком, таким же, повторяющимся.

Ну и самое главное, можно мне выбирать? Хоть как-то? О, этот момент, когда от того, что выбираешь, зависит продолжение игры, некая загадочность. Такого тут точно не будет.
Здесь все определено и понятно. 

Не рекомендую.

author: {'steamid': '76561198227169216', 'num_games_owned': 632, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 996, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 996, 'last_played': 1465000226}
review: 虽然中途出门挂了次机，实际上游戏3个小时不到就能快速浏览完。剧情平淡，有点亮点，不过没啥吸引力；文字也不甚优美。好在幸和明美还是个很可爱的角色。其实玩这游戏也是为了支持一下希尔薇的作者，再就是一满好奇和猎奇心。对这类级别的作品，没有什么深刻讨论一番，然后给差评的必要，没有特别厌恶的地方，就给好评是没问题的。

review:
Not much can be said about this game. It is short (around 2-3 hours), and if it's worth 10 bucks is something that everybody has to decide for themselves. However, the Story is really sweet and heartwarming, and the Artstyle is kinda unique and all in all, I had a good time with it. 

So yeah, if you don't want to spend 10 bucks on 2-3 hours of good story, wait for a sale. Trust me, you won't regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076014966', 'num_games_owned': 904, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 339, 'last_played': 1462062526}
review:
For a game made in 2 months this's fairly impressive, but for a game on Steam with an asking price of  $10 it's very underwhelming.

I understand the constraints the dev was under to get this game ready in time for a convention he wished to sell it at, but there's no reason why afterwards, when the pressure was gone, that he couldn't have revisited the title and expanded upon it before putting it onto a larger market, such as Steam.

As it stands the story is decent, but nothing spectacular. More than once there were times you'd expect there to be more shown, but he just ends up alluding to events and then skipping right over them (presumably cuts made to get the game done on time). The story with the main antagonist ended in a very unsatisfactory manner, though I will refrain from expanding on that any further to avoid spoilers. Most of the side characters also didn't really get as much time as I would have liked in order to get to know them better. Also - unless you share in some of the creator's fetishes for things like injuries - a lot of the dialog will seem forced, weird or unnecessary as they are mainly tacked on to serve his own indulgences.

The art style is nice and the main selling point that drew me to this title. Though as with everything else about this game, it would have been nice to have had more of it, for instance there was very little by way of CG stills/cutscenes. However, it does have a far more coherent and enjoyable aesthetic than most other amateur VN offerings and deserves a fair bit of praise for that alone.

Sound was just so-so. Some of the music could use a bit of work, there were some grating off key notes thrown in inexpertly throughout a few of the tracks that detracted from my enjoyment, but otherwise the soundtrack was ok and fit the story well enough.

Overall, I enjoyed it, but the creator really should put another 2-4 months into completing this, then this would be well worth the asking price and a highly recommended title for those who enjoy quirky VNs. But as it stands I can't recommend it unless you find it on a pretty decent sale, as you just wont get your money's worth otherwise.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013599764', 'num_games_owned': 1092, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1463554853}
review:
It is important to understand exactly what you are getting with this game, before you purchase it. I bought it when it was on sale and considering the entertainment I got out of it I can safely say that it was money well spent. So if you enter this game with the idea of it just been a relaxing story that you can spen an hour or two with it is definitely worth a purchase.

Pros:

Amazing art, the style simply is gorgeous, and the small cutscenes are wonderfully handled
Interesting story and characters, every character feels like an actual person with consistent behaviours

Cons

Feels like there are elements of the story that may be missing
Ending is not quite complete (Definitive, but those looking for an ending that ties up all loose ends may be disappointed).

So in conclusion, should you buy this game... well it depends, I enjoyed it and can easily recommend it to fans of the genre, but it is worth going in with the expectations that it is a short experience that will leave you wanting more. Having said that though the fact that it leaves such a strong impression means that if you ever see it cheap don't even hesitate to try it, what it does it does well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018056824', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 300, 'last_played': 1462733657}
review:
I've had my eye on this visual novel for a while, and after playing it, I can see why people like it. The story is told through the lens of Mamoru, who one day meets Sachi, a pupil who is regularly bullied and has lost sight of her dreams. When Mamoru first contacts her, she is very shy towards him. However, they end up seeing eye-to-eye on many things, and their relationship is magnified as a result.

Since this is a kinetic VN, most of the story is told through one point of view, and the exploration of themes is a bit near-sighted because of its short length, but for what it's worth, this is a pretty decent feel-good game that doesn't lose focus on its artistic vision. Because of that, I can turn a blind eye on its faults and recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198163189386', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 184, 'last_played': 1465557784}

author: {'steamid': '76561198204799004', 'num_games_owned': 116, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 229, 'last_played': 1462688110}
review:
I bought this game on a whim during a steam sale, the picture of the cute cyclops girl roped me in I'll admit.

The game is really just a straighforward visual novel, with no gameplay, and no choices in said game. That's not a bad thing per se, although I'll admit it would have been nice to have some choices.

Overall Love at First Sight is a cute little visual novel that'll take around three hours to read. I enjoyed the story as well as the characters. The art is nice and I found myself engrossed in it's story. Since I bought this on a sale I don't know if it's really worth ten dollars, but if you're a fan of romantic visual novels then I definitely recommend checking it out. My only real complaint is that there are a few typos in the English version, but since it was originally in Japanese it's a bit understandable, and the typos aren't very common.

So if you're a fan of these types of games then I recommend it, it's cute, and I certainly enjoyed reading it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971656367', 'num_games_owned': 455, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1462437779}
review:
I love the art for the game, but I feel if the writing had a darker tone it would fit much better.  I bought this for the art and the cyclops, but neither of those really made up for the writing---and thus I kinda regret the purchase.

The only time the love interest being a cyclops really comes into play is the initial meeting with her and the small part where we're viewing her from the antagonists perspective. Otherwise it's just vauge statements about her getting weird looks and nothing that actually affects the story. You could change out any mention of her being a cyclops to her being ugly / purple skinned / a reptilian and the story would be the same. 

There's no real buildup in the story and the relationship develops in such an easy and predictable way that it's not satisfying at all. The cyclops girls also has some fanservice trait where you touch her healing scars and she gets all blushy 'nnnh' about it. I guess it was supposed to help illustrate them strengthening their bond but it didn't really feel that way. The story didn't give me a sense that I earned the love of the cyclops at all.

Also, each chapter has an 'animated' title card. Interesting, but they were animated weirdly and didn't look that good at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198147992423', 'num_games_owned': 183, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1462403438}
review:
If you're looking for something nice to read when you're bored, and are into romance, this is a decent buy.

It was a cute and relaxing story featuring a lovable heroine and a respectable MC. As a common reader of romance manga, this series was right up my alley.

The only issues I had with this "game" is simply a lack of "game-like" features as the author had mentioned in the Afterword. It would have been nice to see some options thrown in as well as different paths/endings, and varying artwork throughout.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104670355', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1462243112}
review:
Sweet, unusual and heartwarming. I will try to keep this completely spoiler-free, which means I will probably not talk much about it story-wise.

- Story and Characters

You must have noticed that the heroine of this VN isn't your mainstream moe heroine, she's way more cute and interesting. I won't say anything else about her, because I found out that actually getting to know her through the story is what made this such a great experience for me.

The story is short and the cast small, but I loved every part of it, even the slightly strange ones.
You have two very likeable characters as your support casting, who are not just filling up the space, but instead have their own things going on. Their personalities are also built very clear, so that the way they act and interact with you and the other characters feels very natural.

Also, don't forget to check the Extras after you finish. There are a few extra scenes there.

- VN

Now, for the technical stuff.
This is a linear visual novel with a single route. Which means it's more like a digital book than a game itself, and to be fair most visual novels are exactly that. I would say the greatest selling point of this kind of product is that you get an experience similar to those you would get from reading books, comics or manga, but with the extras allowed by the medium used to convey the story.

A story can be conveyed in many different forms. A linear visual novel allows you to attach shifting scenes to every piece of dialogue, with characters in different poses over backgrounds. You are also allowed to place pictures drawn for special events, and in this game's case, even small cutscenes for every chapter title. And finally, wrap it all up with music fitting for every moment. This is an experience that is most close to reading a novel, with many additionals you'd only get from it being digital.
If this is what you came here looking for, then Love at First Sight is indeed what you want.

- Art

As for the art, I feel particularly drawn to the hard lines and the painting style, which reminds me of another VN that I live very much, which is Danganronpa. The animated cutscenes are very well made and looked really cute. I enjoyed it.

- Music

The music in the game feels really nice to the ears and blends well with the ambience. Most of the times, I barely even notice it's presence, as I felt it was part of the scene itself and not just something on the background. My regards to kyou1110 for the great work, though I did like every song of the game.

- Conclusion

Finally, I want to congratulate Ray-K for making this great game. Making a game isn't easy, and making a game by yourself is a hard challenge. But, making a game of this quality by yourself is no short of heroic. People like you and Toby Fox are what I consider heroes in this industry. So, in short, thank you very much.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004499950', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 526, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 526, 'last_played': 1462204067}
review:
A cute little VN with a simple but very heart-warming story. An enjoyable reading for a relaxing afternoon. 
The story itself is a pretty straightforword romance tale. There're no surprising plot-turning events. Everything goes exactly as you expect it would be, yet in a very delicate and graceful way. 
Sachi is extremely adorable depite her extraordinary look, and I fell in love with her at the first sight just like the protagonist did. Her character development is also smooth and believable, and gets you attached to her from start to end. Unfortunately other characters could use a more polish, maybe especially for Mayumi. 
Art design is the selling point here IMO. Ray-K's heavy, rough and somewhat eerie style gives the game a distinguishing look just like the heroine. It may not look as exquisite as some of the other VNs, but it's stunningly beautiful and fits the theme very well. 
Music is  pretty simple, nothing stands out but certainly not annoying. Missing Love is a nice little piece.   
There're also some fun stuff to check out in Extras after finishing the story if you are interested. They give some insights about the game's development, also some mini episodes that add to the main story.
To sum up, if you like a sweet, peaceful romance story with a very adorable girl that makes you urge to sympahize and protect,  definitely give this one a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074771219', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1507328410}
review:
Ci vuole coraggio a prendere i propri fetish e dal nulla farli diventare un gioco, così come (in modo molto giapponese) a scusarsi per le mancanze nella produzione, i difetti e i problemi che hanno portato a dover tagliare molti contenuti, come ha fatto l'autore Ray-kbys negli extra accessibili una volta completata la storia. Per questo il mio voto è positivo.

Però va detto che quasi 10€ sono una cifra folle per i contenuti che questo gioco offre: una kinetic novel (cioè una visual novel senza scelte) che dura a malapena 3 ore, con una storia fin troppo semplice, personaggi credibili ma abbastanza stereotipati e musichette ripetitive al massimo. 4€ sono già tanti. E ora il punto focale: il fatto che la protagonista sia una ciclope è del tutto irrilevante ai fini della storia e serve solo a distinguere il titolo da cento altri simili e a soddisfare i fetish dell'autore. E ad accalappiare i fan delle monstergirls come me...

author: {'steamid': '76561198055874257', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1549399959}
review:
ひとめぼれ, or
"Love at First Sight". It only has one route and only takes an hour or two to complete, but it is exceptionally cute and heartwarming. I'm normally not into lovey-dovey stuff but this one made me feel very warm inside. I recommend it to anyone who is looking for a short story to read or something to take up part of your evening.

author: {'steamid': '76561198190303906', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1461975892}
review:
Don't be fooled! Their love develops gradually, not at first sight.

Other than that, it's not a bad way to spend a few hours. This is not the greatest visual novel of all time, but the characters are interesting and distinctive, the music fits the mood well, the art is good, and the story progresses nicely. There's only one route, though.

Overall, if you want a quick, cheap visual novel, this isn't a bad choice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198207170604', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1465233950}
review:
ちょっと前に話題になったエロゲーの"Teaching Feeling 奴隷との生活"の作者のRay-Kbysさんがそちらの前から発表していたノベルゲー。和名ではひと目惚れ.
Teaching Feelingはプレイしたことないので詳細は知らないのですが、神ゲーらしいです。

この作品を一言で表すと、もうとにかくヒロインの単眼少女の臼井幸がひたすらかわいいということです。
健気で謙虚で真面目で、でも自分の外見にコンプレックスがあるがためのおどおどとした様子が抜群に保護欲を刺激します。
そんな彼女にしつこく話しかけて、打ち解けようとして、徐々に関係が進展していく様はもう最高ですね。眼福です。
イベントではさまれる餌付けをするシーンや、オシャレな格好で対面するシーンはもう何回でも見直しました。SSも100枚くらい撮りました。めっちゃ[strike]抜けます[/strike]泣けます。
あと登場する友人がいい人ばかりなのも好感をもてます。
もっと拒絶とか、反論とか、いろいろないの？とかって思う人もいるかもしれませんが、個人的にはドロドロした韓国の恋愛ドラマのような胃に穴があきそうなお話は嫌いなので、ちょっとライトなくらいで、途中からは終始ベタベタして糖尿病になるくらい甘ったるくて思わず爆撃したくなるようなお話のほうが好きです。
ただそれで終わるだけでなく、ちゃんと登場人物それぞれの考えがありますし、途中で視点が変わって話が進んだりするのも登場人物の理解が進むのでGood.

先天奇形のひとつの単眼症を患って生まれた子供は、出生後すぐ亡くなってしまうので、臼井幸の年齢まで生きている子はまずいないらしいですが、そんなことは気にしてはいけないんです。

とにもかくにもかわいい、KAWAII、めちゃんこかわいいです。
普段ホラーサウンドノベル(かまいたちの夜、忌火起草、暑いから(フリーゲーム)etc...)をプレイすることはあっても、恋愛ノベルはまったくプレイしない私ですが、購入してよかったと心のそこから思えるすンばらしい作品です。
続編製作中らしいので、そちらがでたら１００％即日買います。
2時間くらいでクリアできてしまいますし、ストーリーも分岐なし、ボイスなしですが、買って損はしないと思います。セールを待たずに買ってもいいと思います。

ちなみに作者さんのpixivには臼井幸以外にもかわいらしい奇形の子とかいっぱいです。
奇形じゃない子もいます。どの子も魅力的で見てて楽しいです。
えっちな絵もえっちじゃない絵もグロい絵もむっちゃ興奮するので超オススメです。
ぜひ見に行ってみてください。

author: {'steamid': '76561198075711036', 'num_games_owned': 309, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 378, 'last_played': 1462640299}
review:
Todos los puntos importantes de una novela visual:
[list]
[*] [b]Dibujo:[/b] El estilo de Ray-K: Le gustan las temáticas oscuras como el gore... En este juego se nota su estilo aunque de forma más suave en comparación con sus ilustraciones.
[*] [b]Fondos:[/b] Los fondos acompañan al diseño de los personajes y a las situaciones. No hay demasiados tampoco pero la historia es corta.
[*] [b]Historia:[/b] Es una historia corta pero suficiente. Puede resultar conodida (repetida): Chica con problemas, protagonista que intenta protegerla, aparece el amor en el proceso.
[*] [b]Personajes:[/b] Los personajes rellenan la historia. No hay demasiados pero realmente muy en el fondo solo te interesa Sachi, la chica cíclope.
[*] [b]Música:[/b] la música acompaña a la historia sin entrometerse demasiado. No produce grades sensaciones pero tampoco es música de ascensor. Hace agradable la experiencia del juego.
[*] [b]Rutas:[/b] Sólo existe una ruta. No hay decisiones que tomar. El propio autor comenta que este hecho le decepciona pero que por tiempo no puedo hacer todo lo que quiso.
[*] Doblaje: No tiene voz.
[*] Idioma: Está disponible en japonés y en Inglés. La traducción al inglés es correcta y sencilla. No se necesita mucho nivel de inglés para disfrutarla.
[*] [b]Contenido extra:[/b] Tienes disponibles todas las ilustraciones, pistas de audio y exras sobre los personajes, la historia y los pensamientos del autor.
[/list]

En Steam tienes logros, cartas y demás.

Si te ha llamado la atención seguramente sea porque la protagonista es una chica cíclope.
Si eres fan de las monster girls, ya sea por [i]Monster Girl Encyclopedia[/i], [i]Monster Girl Quest[/i] o por proyectos ejn curso como [i]Monster Girl Island[/i] o [i]Breeding Season[/i] o por cualquier otra relación con la temática monster girl este es el juego que necesitas en tu biblioteca de Steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120348301', 'num_games_owned': 1313, 'num_reviews': 433, 'playtime_forever': 393, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 393, 'last_played': 1459728092}
review:
Really cute kinetic VN. I loved the relationship between Mamoru and Sachi, it was really cute (although he was kinda pushy sometimes). The art style was unique, just lovely! BG and BGM were also amazing. I’m looking forward to see more titles from this developer!

I do not recommend this game for people who feel triggered about bullying, tho.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986310914', 'num_games_owned': 6578, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1558792815}
review:
Love at First Sight is a short (2h) kinetic VN (no choices) telling the story of a freshly transferred student who fall in love with Sachi, a bullied, one eyed, pale and clumsy girl. Art style is gorgeous (there is even more on developer's Pixiv!), there are some animated scenes of Sachi serving as chapter's transition, music is enjoyable, there is no voice acting. The story is interesting but you have that feeling sometimes that the game was rushed, atleast the text is fluid to read. 

Got the game during a sale and would also recommend to wait for one due to the short length but anyway it's worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012875077', 'num_games_owned': 517, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 481, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 481, 'last_played': 1459111872}
review:
Love at First Sight is a sweet love story between Momoru and Sachi, a girl with only one big eye. It's quite short, but I really enjoyed every moment of it. It focuses mostly on Momoru and Sachi,
but also the friendship between the couple and Momoru's two other friends; Tomoyori and Akemi. Sachi is different from her classmates and bullied, as a result of that, she's very shy and kind of scared of others. When Momoru tries to befriend her, she's scared at first but slowly opens up to him.

I found Love at First Sight randomly online, and decided to buy it on Steam because it looked like a very cute (and odd) story. The art is fantastic and the story turned out to be really good as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097473186', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 439, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 439, 'last_played': 1458930001}
review: I first saw this game from a youtuber who does a bunch of anime style games (LostPause aka Noble), he did one episode on it that lasted about 30 or so minutes. I had always wanted him to continue this game but after I played it myself I see why he didn't. This game is simple, the creator even bashes himself for doing this in the afternotes, however I like the game more cause of it. There's no way to fail this game, no way to go down a path you didn't want to take, no way to mess something up. The music, as simplistic as it is, is very nice and catchy and changes somewhat frequently, my most favorite track was when there was drama with Rui. The story is nice and simple, shy girl who has no courage or anything like that and gets bullied, falls in love with a boy who loves her back, she slowly comes out of her shell and even stands up to her bully, an almost cliche type of character development but at least it's there, some games the characters develop so little during hours of gameplay if at all. The only thing that really makes Sachi different is the fact that she's a cyclops, other than that she's no different from anyone else, and as a guy who doesn't judge on appearances I easily see why Ma-Kun (don't want to type his name wrong) was attracted to her, heck I'd date her if she existed. Could this game be longer, yes (note it says I have like 7 hours into the game but I had left it running while did other things) but just because it's short is really only something that an individual has to decides is a good or bad thing. Do you want a game that you play for hours and not get anywhere significant (like most rpg's) or do you want to play a game that's short but be entertained while you play for those few short hours. Is this a perfect game, no but most aren't, I personally would've liked to see Tomo and Akemi get more and more intimate and actually admit how they feel, round 2 of Ms. Bully (Rui) and Ms. Upbeat (Akemi), and even a b*tch slap delivered to Rui via the small scarred hand of Sachi, but those are personal nitpicks, maybe in a continuation of this story and again I would prefer it this style, simple straight to the point, just something that you'll sit down to for an hour or two just to enjoy a nice little romance story without the filler of anime or the images of manga or the complexity of a dating sim (cause let's be honest some of these styles of games can be pretty complex with their choice/path system and all sorts of flags) I would personally rate this a 4/5, it's simple, fun, no hassle, just an overrall carefree game. I recommend this to any fan of anime, manga, and vn's who just want to a nice time and relax.

在游戏中，玩家们能够发现在剧情对话中，人物的形象生动而活泼，口型会随着剧情的内容而变动，虽说独眼的猎奇造型令不少玩家感到困惑，但一旦接受了这个设定后，女主角不是一般的萌。游戏有着漂亮温馨的画风，对于一款视觉小说来说，游戏能够让玩家们更好的参与进去，享受一段温馨的剧情。喜欢清新作的可以体验下。
目前游戏只有日文和英文。汉化版本正在测试中。
(汉化补丁已经在贴吧推出啦)
你问我会不会继续喜欢独眼娘呢？那当然是会的。
还有人问我会喜欢多久，真的很难解答唉！但是不会那么容易就放弃喜欢的角色的。
当然，我们的独眼娘神教会继续扩大的
欢迎来独眼娘吧做客(^-^)
如果喜欢也可以关注我的b站账号谢谢

author: {'steamid': '76561198149160735', 'num_games_owned': 183, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1475575979}

author: {'steamid': '76561198117264848', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1458044356}
review:
Ok, eye will do my best to hold off on the ocular related puns.

This game is short, sweet and to the point. 

The characters are pretty interesting and likeable for the most part, although the MC is a bit of a goose at times and a tad pushy but hey, considering how short the game is (2 or so hours) a fair amount of development goes on and any shortcomings in character development are hardly noticible.  The pacing and story is great with only a few dull moments here and there.

This isn't a typical romance VN. Its not overly cheesy, has more going on thematically then just romance including some kind of unsettling moments, and other characters (well 2 out of the 3 more minor ones) actually have a significant role to play in the story, so you don't  feel like you're trapped following a hapless protag around while he tries to get laid.

Pros
- Great art style. which is mostly what caught my eye about the game (heuheuheuhueh)
- Music is pretty decent too.
- The story is interesting enough and has some pretty cool moments
- SACHI!!!!!!!
- Short and good for when you don't feel like taking on a 50+ hour epic with 1000+ choices.
- No choices (could be a pro or con)
- Got oddly aroused during a certain scene and now find myself asking some hard questions.

Cons
- It could be a bit longer but by the Devs own admission, he rushed the game to reach a deadline and didn't get to add more routes/ choices etc.
- Sometimes the protag is kind of annoying, but hey, writing facless yet relatible characters that players can project onto is hard.


10/10 would date a cyclops gorl again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040427321', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1458024554}
review:
While this game doesn't seem to be the highest budget VN you'll see on Steam, It certainly is worth the price, considering the beautiful artwork and fairly interesting story.

Outside of that... That's really all it has going for it. It isn't voiced, repetitive music, moderately interesting, and pretty short. It's also got some pretty creepy things going on with it, including the obvious dating a cyclops thing, and sachi constantly asking you "Hey.. wanna feel muh scars?"

I'll just keep this pretty simple.
It's worth the ten dollars, nothing more, nothing less.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078157014', 'num_games_owned': 826, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 295, 'last_played': 1457593495}
review:
Before I start comment, I have to say that I am Ray-k's fan since I bought his CG works on dlsite. And this game is for collection so I bought it one more time.

I actually recommend to buy this game on dlsite for the discount.

-----------------

This game has...
Pros
>Super cute waifu+heart warming story+school love comedy.

>GIF...good and decent

>steam card!? Yes it can trade and I LOVE collect more CG, and those cgs ARE DIFFERENT FROM THE GAME.

>English/Japanese script.

>The topic of bullying hidden in the story is good. That's something we still need to work on in real world.

Cons:
>A little too short story.

>Not a huge problem, but if they have voice acting will be better.

General conclusion:

8/10, and if you want to try other stuff from Ray-k, google Teaching Feeling.

Yes, that's another fetish but good VN every one should try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198273536383', 'num_games_owned': 712, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 2527, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 62, 'playtime_at_review': 2084, 'last_played': 1712474600}
review:
（其实这个评测在三个月前就写好了）说真的我确实为了这个游戏入的steam。听说steam上面有卖的就赶紧下了steam。
那么闲话少说，首先我虽然在自学日语，但是我还是用的英语，不得不很佩服Ray-K老师的画风，以及剧情的设计，他的作品剧情非常的和我的口（我玩gal很久了 也喜欢看少女漫画 个人非常喜欢 ps.也经常幻想这种剧情）虽然老师后记里谦虚地说是因为便宜等原因才选择做游戏而不去做同人志，还有因为制作时间不够而表达了歉意 但是真的已经很棒了 我相信很多人都是因为奴隶的生活来玩这款游戏的 并且开始认识画师的 但是我相信你们会发现这部作品比奴隶生活更加地值得品味（没有R18内容，如有需要请去p站找Ray K老师）。
必须要说的一点，这个口语翻译的真的很地道，Ray-Kbys老师在最后提到了自己曾经在美国呆了6年（如果我没记错的话）难道说是他自己翻译的么（笑）
总之In a word ,awesome!

author: {'steamid': '76561197995105285', 'num_games_owned': 6098, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 293, 'last_played': 1455607955}
review: I feel kind of weird recommending this game, honestly: it's short, has no branching story paths, and other reviews are definitely not exaggerating the freaky level of erotic scar-touching that happens in this VN. However, there's just something so sweet behind all of it that I couldn't help but end up quite charmed by the whole thing. Nothing really exciting happens, this isn't a horror VN. It's a high school slice-of-life VN where one character just happens to have one giant eye in the centre of her head. If it's on sale and you like cheesy high school romance, there are definitely worse ways you could spend an afternoon.

review: One of the best Visual Novels I have played, granted it is a bit short, but it has excellent art, and a heartwarming story. Parts of the story could have been done better, as the creator mentions in the afterward, but overall it is some real quality. The hours spent with this game were touching and well spent. Buy this game if you love Monster Girls and the artist, Ray-K.  I hope one day he makes another game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198061455624', 'num_games_owned': 1086, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1455309225}
review:
Look, I want to give this game a pass. It's cute, it's a small production, it clearly has some love behind it. But I can't. It's not good. The art is occasionally off-putting, the characters are one-note and the plot is formula 'freak-romance' where the girl falls for the guy because he can look past her eccentricities and that makes the main character special. Also the soundtrack  routinely hits strange sour notes.

All of that would be forgivable if it wasn't the entire experience. Apparently half-way through the story (It's pretty short as these things go) I found myself trying to look at the good parts of the experience, but the only good is has is 'the art is kinda cute' but switching through the same four characters and backgrounds for the entire experience couldn't save it.

I really genuinely can't recommend it, even to those into this kind of thing. It's not that there's bad content here, it's that there's no good content to look for.
