author: {'steamid': '76561197993471534', 'num_games_owned': 527, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 187, 'last_played': 1432382648}
review:
First things first: Sachi a cute. Ignore the haters.

Hitomebore is a love story visual novel that, from my understanding, was made mostly by one person. Originally released last year at COMITIA 107, the Steam version comes with improved CGs and an English translation by Sekai Project. Hitomebore runs on Renpy, which is fairly uncommon for a Japanese production despite its status as the go-to visual novel framework in the West, so that's quite interesting.

The game's strongest point (by a considerable margin) is its creepy look. There is a short animated clip whenever the chapter changes. Unfortunately, like so many other visual novels, the game runs natively in a low, 4:3 resolution.

Music is MIDI-tier at times, but not unpleasant to listen to. I kind of like the main theme in fact, but it's not something I'd listen to outside of the game.

Story is where it all falls apart, both in terms of length and writing quality. Without spoiling anything, let's just say that the game never takes full advantage of its fairly unique theme of having a girl with one eye. You could replace it with a different condition without having to rewrite much of the story, which by the way is high school drama that we all have seen a thousand times before. Highlights are the scene where the MC feeds Sachi, and the scenes where he touches her scars. You will be getting about 2-3 hours of story, which for its price tag is quite short.

For 10 bucks I can't recommend it due to its length and writing, but since Sachi is such a likeable character and the game is an indie product, I can't regret spending 10 bucks on it either.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105447505', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1434024745}
review:
[h1]単眼少女に恋をするノベルゲーム[/h1]

あらすじ：とある高校に転校してきた主人公、『福永護』がひょんなことから校内で噂されていた単眼少女『臼井幸』と出会い、その瞳に引きこまれていく。

もともと製作者がPixivに投稿していたオリジナルキャラクターである『臼井幸』を元に作ったゲームが本作らしく、音楽以外は全て個人で開発したそうな。

[b]内容[/b]
見てわかる通り単眼という割と特殊なジャンルなので好みは分かれるかも。
しかしヘビーなストーリーという訳でもないので、特に抵抗がなければ女の子のために頑張ってアプローチをする男子高校生とコンプレックスを抱える健気な女子高生のラブコメとして楽しめると思う。
単眼好きな人なら更にポイント高し。

見づらいけれど、既読スキップ・Autoモードは画面の左上にあるので、システム面にも特に不満はなし。

シナリオは2時間程度。選択肢等のない一本道のストーリー。トレカ対応。
ストアページには実績について記述されていないけどライブラリには実績表示されているからいずれ対応するのかも。（6月11日のパッチにより解除可能になりました）
実績内容的には普通に読み進めれば全実績解除できそうなのでその点でもオススメ


スエゾー

author: {'steamid': '76561198092635337', 'num_games_owned': 1608, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1442244256}

author: {'steamid': '76561198152963440', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 264, 'last_played': 1432450688}
review:
I've developed a scar fetish thanks to Love at First Sight. 

T-thanks, Sekai Project.

-----

Quirky and adorable; this indie VN keeps you engaged, entertained and locked in for its brisk few hours of story. "Short and sweet, doesn't overstay its welcome," is probably how I'd phrase it. Lots of upbeat and oddball humor that works incredibly well, with a fun, small cast of core characters. If you're in the mood for a nice, little romance story this is a must, especially for all you monster-girl fans. 

The unlockable extras after the main game are worth the price alone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030459160', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1656860403}

author: {'steamid': '76561198055323794', 'num_games_owned': 667, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 189, 'last_played': 1436359700}
review:
To be honest, I didn't really expect anything great when I bought this game ( the sole reason I did was because it exists... lel) but damn.... it's cute as hell.
Obviously It doesn't quite compete with titles backed by huge companies (e.g. Princess Evangile) or titles that just had years and years of programming involved (e.g. Katawa Shoujo) but holy hell is it worth its money. The heroine is really cute (not sure whether I should say "even with" or "because of") her conditions, Mr. MC is -quite surprisingly- not a dense piece of junk and all the side characters are unique and fun (lets just ignore Miss SBJK(props if you get this) for now).
The story pretty much goes as you'd expect (some might call it 'generic' but I think it's simply the best way to go about a story like that in most cases) and the development is fun to watch (although it DOES feel a bit like it was too fast at times). 
It's a Kinetic Novel (=no choices/paths), but I didn't mind as I wouldn't have want the story to have any major differences from what we have now, the only thing that's a bit sad is that it's only about 3 hours long (4 if you take your time and look at all the extras and stuff)
Overall, i really recommend this VN if you have the money and want to die of cuteness. Also: eye puns, god-damn eye puns

author: {'steamid': '76561197970555024', 'num_games_owned': 1051, 'num_reviews': 177, 'playtime_forever': 235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 235, 'last_played': 1432194010}
review:
Love At First Sight is the story of a boy who meets a girl who doesn't look “normal”, and how they slowly come to know and then love each other. 
Being a fan of anime I am used to eyes so big that they would shame the average Seville orange, but this time we are talking melon size. Surely there can't any room left in that head for a brain? Ah, whatever. The only thing more bizarre is her choice in clothes. A melon wrapped in pink meringue springs to mind.
The story is quite cute, but I found something slightly disturbing about it. It's a very typical Japanese anime relationship that develops very slowly and is really gentle. All good so far. It tries to deal with the issues of a person who doesn't conform to norms…. but you get the idea that the female protagonist was made that way to appeal to the small number of males who find solace in the belief that if normal girls don't like them then maybe they can find an abnormal one that will.  Maybe I am being too harsh, but I have never really liked the overly demure female characters that seem fairly popular with Otakus. The novel goes so far to refer to the player as the protagonist at several points in the game, making it very clear who this game is aimed at.  
In short, I think this novel will appeal to a niche market. It is very well produced, the illustrations are just fine, and while some will find the story very cute, others will be perplexed by it. I do recommend it, but with a lot of reservation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080289123', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1434174595}

author: {'steamid': '76561198028197715', 'num_games_owned': 941, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1688149262}
review:
Love at First Sight isn't very good. I'll start with that. The game's story is nothing to write home about. It's a boring, standard, high-school romance. Now, sure, there's nothing wrong with a clichéd story, but if a story's going to be cliché, it needs to make up for it in some other area.

Okay, so if the story's cliché, how about the characters? Well, they're just as two-dimensional as the story. The protagonist is a VN protagonist. He's 'nice,' kind of, and that is all there is to him. The cyclops girl, Sachi, is the shy one who doesn't have any friends. The supporting cast is comprised of the loud one and the cynical one. That's all I remember about them. The antagonist is 'the bully', who I'm convinced only exists to justify the writer ham-fisting his fetish for scars into the game. 

Did I mention that the author really likes scars? Because there are at least three different scenes in the game where the protagonist touches Sachi's scars. Each scene is written with the sort of lurid prose you see when you know that the writer is masturbating furiously to what they're writing.

Moving away from the author's fetishes, let's talk about the soundtrack. It's even worse than the story. Every song is made using bad MIDI instruments that don't mesh well. The songs themselves have no sense of what constitutes a good melody or harmony, leaving a soundtrack that manages to almost be mediocre at its very best.

The art's interesting enough, it has a decent, sketch-like aesthetic, but I question if that's intentional or just a result of the fact that the game was made in the space of two months by a single guy.

Now, length: The game is an hour and a half long. It's an appropriate length for what it is, but certainly not worth the ten dollars it's charging.

All in all, this game is really not very good and there are so many things better than this that you could be spending your money on. Hell, there are visual novels better (and longer) than this at the same price point or lower on Steam right now.

tl;dr: If you really, [i]really[/i] like cyclops girls, amateurish storytelling, and scars, I won't stop you from buying this. For everyone else, give it a pass.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993928733', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 172, 'last_played': 1432100402}
review: This is a very cute game. Now normally I enjoy a visual novel that has decisions and different paths and the likes, but it's always nice when i can play a visual novel and just enjoy reading it. Even with the shortness of it, it accomplished this and i would gladly buy more from this author. Honestly, it would be great if there was a new game in the future  that perhaps continues this story. Great music and artwork, it was very fresh to me. In conclusion, if you're up for a cute, short story about a somewhat peculiar girl, Love at First Sight is the game for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100519629', 'num_games_owned': 1240, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 325, 'last_played': 1434052057}
review:
Mientras otras tantas novelas visuales ofrecen chicas voluptuosas, chicas gato con poca ropa o alienigenas con trajes de batalla ultra pegados, llega  Love At First Sight ofreciendo una premisa simple, eres un chico normal que un dia se encuentra con una ciclope y se enamora de ella.
¿por qué? ¿Pues por qué no?

10/10 IGN

author: {'steamid': '76561197991855534', 'num_games_owned': 647, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1432480519}
review:
So this will be my first review, so go easy on me.

About the Game:

The Game has a really daring story about, let's say an unnatural Girl.
It's well written and makes fun to get kinda attached to the story line.

It took me a little less than an hour to finish it. Not that I expected anything huge of it anyway.
Some people might take longer, I guess up to 2 hours if you really wants to emerge with the Characters.

I can say, after finishing it, that I don't mind the price of it. 

A really good aspect of the game is, that you'll get to "take action" of other characters beside the protagonist.

The only thing that could have been done better would be revealing more about the background story of the characters. But who knows, games are patch-able so maybe that is on its way too.

TL:DR

Worth the Price, a really decent VN Imho.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118900908', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1432520683}
review: Cute cyclops. Cute art. Cute story. Not the longest VN out there, only a couple hours of play, but a very enjoyable read and worth the cost. It's perfect to take a break with this from if you don't want to invest too much time or energy into a new title.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097366627', 'num_games_owned': 1631, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1432143355}
review:
新しい境地、単眼娘とイチャラブするビジュアルノベルゲーム。
選択肢等はなく一本道。トレーディングカードや、日本産の物としては珍しく日本語対応（よくよく考えなくてもそれが普通だと思いたいが）
世界観設定はよくある異世界系とか、妖怪が普通に暮らしてたりなんて事も無く、現実世界。妖怪は出てこないし、妖怪のせいにもならない。
少し駆け足気味ではあるが、起承転結がしっかりしており楽しめる。

わずか2時間足らずでクリアしたので、ボリュームは少々物足りないかなと感じた。
この世界観設定では単眼はかなり異質だと感じるのだが、登場人物のほとんどは意外と簡単に受け入れちゃってたり、周りからのバッシングは少ない。あくまでイチャラブするゲームなのか、単眼という設定の割には重たい場面はかなり少なめ。

・良い点
　・臼井 幸（ヒロイン）がかわいい
　・意外と軽めなので気楽に楽しめる
　・アイキャッチがちょっとしたアニメーション
　・ギャラリーモード、オマケエピソード等がある

・残念な点
　・誤変換、誤字が目立つ事
　・単眼設定以外はありがちなストーリー

残念な点に関しては、作者のあとがきにて作者は数年アメリカ在住だったとの事や、製作に当たる時間がとんでもなく短かった事からある程度察しは付くかなと思います・・・（言い訳）

このボリュームで1000円はちょっと高いかな・・・と感じますが、作者の熱意と愛（フェチ・趣味）に溢れた、まさにインディーゲームと思える作品です。興味がある方は触れてみると宜しいかと思いますよ。



↓ちょっとネタバレ
[spoiler]臼井 幸をいじめていた子の、いじめていた理由が「単眼だから」ではなく、「弱腰な性格が気に食わないから」という事だと知って安心しました。（「単眼だから」というだけの理由で虐げられていたわけではない事を知り、安心した）[/spoiler]
よかった。この世界は平和だ。おわり

author: {'steamid': '76561198070592146', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1434141941}
review:
I suck with reviews
Like I'm terrible at them
But I'll try my best lol
I wouldn't call this a "review", but more of a "my experience"

[b]**(Disclaimer if you are not knowledgeable of Visual Novels)**[/b]
A VN, or Visual Novel, is exactly what it is. Like reading a book or short story on a tablet or your computer.
Some give you the option to make decisions while others are simply telling a story. There are plenty of Visual Novels on other places besides Steam. Some good, bad, serious, funny, all-ages, and the more adult oriented ones.
If you'd like you can check out more here [url=https://vndb.org/]Visual Novel Database[/url]

[b]I am still very very VERY new to the VN scene.[/b]
I have a few more VN's stashed away for a rainy day, but my Japanese is at level 0

Anyways
This isn't actually a review, but more of a "my experience with this Visual Novel"


[b]So the overall Story[/b]:
(I'll try to not to go into detail to spoil any of it. So I apologize if my review seems a bit blunt)
The story takes about 2 - 3 hours to complete and gets to the point rather quickly.
As most of you already know from the pictures on its Steam Store Page, it's about the girl with 1 eye.

[b]The Writing[/b]:
I wouldn't say it's the best, but I feel that it could have been worked on better.
The dialogue describes the characters couple that with the character design and you can easily make out which and what kind of personality a character has.
I did get a few laughs from some of the dialogue though.
The Author himself said that he felt that he wished he had more time to work on the game before the deadline to turn his work in.

[b]The Characters[/b]:
(Sorry can't go into too much detail with this!)
You have the
Emotionless
Happy-Go-Lucky
Timid/Shy
The Antagonist
I really wish the Creator took more time to flesh out the Characters more. There are hints that provide what kind of past 1 or 2 characters have had, but as for the rest the Creator doesn't really go into detail about the others.
There seemed to be a lot of potential to give the characters a ton of background story. But I guess the Creator didn't have much time to do that with the deadline so close.

[b]The Music[/b]
The music in a Visual Novel is supposed to set the tone for current events in the story.
But in this case it's a bit of a "hit or miss"
Some of the music just doesn't seem to fit or could have been done better to better fit the mood to either tense it up or bring it back down. 
There were some scenes that didn't need any music at all like some of the classroom scenes.
And certain scenes that needed its own special music different from the usual ones that come up throughout the story.


[b]FINAL THOUGHTS[/b]
The Story itself had a lot of potential to add a lot of things.
[b]Like different endings, different routes, and maybe even more chapters[/b]

If the Creator had more time to flesh out the game more I'm sure he would have made something even more amazing. 
If only he had more time.

[b]***I really wish more Visual Novels would release on Steam
And I really wish that people took the time to play through the VN and review it instead of leaving stupid comments like "SO CUTE WOULD WAIFU AND FUG TO OBLIVION LOL"
I get sick of seeing people with less than an hour of playtime reviewing the game and giving it a review similar to that.
Please try to avoid being these kind of people.
It's an Anime related game on Steam. I get it, but at least try. 
If you want a perfect example of what I'm talking about just look at some of the reviews for other VN's on Steam.***[/b]

They are trying to tell a story, but there are people that think it's a joke because they see a side-boob.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088535919', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1432053403}
review:
Man, I'm a sucker for vanilla shit. This stuff's got me feeling all warm inside. A cute story about Sachi Usui, a Cyclops girl and her first love, you, Mamoru.
A sweet story, with no choices or alternate endings, which is slightly unfortunate. I was hoping for maybe at least two endings for $10. Alas. 
It does feature small cutscenes that are partially animated, which are a sort of creepy-cute sort of thing. 
I'm having a good time with this game, but I feel like I won't play it again
7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198044888274', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 336, 'last_played': 1434026681}
review:
"What is it, a freak show?" 
It could have been, but, No, it's not a freak show....

Don't be put off by the oddity of the main character. I'm happy that I didn't.
I didn't hesitate to buy this, desiring something fresh, and found something that not only feels fresh but also kept me smiling through to and beyond the end.

"Love at First Sight" is a short yet extremely charming visual novel,  set within typical school life, but with atypical characters.
The characters are few, but they all endearing and all contribute to the flavour of the story

Sachi, the heroine, is a timid and quiet girl that is "ocularly challenged".
Mamoru, the protagonist, is a transfer student who happens to be easy going, kind and is immediately, yet inexplicably, drawn to Sachi.
Tomoyori and Akemi are Mamoru's friends, both individually unique in personality, yet caring and accepting of each other and those around them.
Lesser of the cast of characters is Sachi's aunt, Mayumi, and of course, the bully Rui. However, these two offer support to and insight into Sachi's character and condition.

The graphics are refreshingly unique in style, working well within the context of the story and create a captivating atmosphere. Creepy cute.....

Although basic and synthed, the soundtrack works well, adding texture to the unvoiced story and supporting the unique atmosphere. I feel it possibly has more variety than some titles that have higher production budgets or larger support staff in spite of the DIY nature of the music.

Although a short and unvoiced story, it is nonetheless captivating and character attachment develops easily. The protagonist isn't a complete imbecile, and stays true to the name, Mamoru  (Japanese for "protect"). The heroine, Sachi, may be "ocularly challenged", but is a very cute character that is easily loved.

Even though the author makes apologies for his creations shortcomings within the extras, I find no need to criticise the work.
Rather, Love at First Sight is a new favourite of mine, was time well and enjoyably spent, with a pittance of an investment required.

Don't hesitate. Buy it. Enjoy it. Love it (at first sight)!

author: {'steamid': '76561198046502352', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1466607471}
review:
Hitomebore, oder auch Love at First Sight ist eine neue kinetische Visual Novel im Portfolio von Sekai Projekt. Bevor wir aber zu dem eigentlich Review kommen, wie immer erst ein paar Grundinformationen. Ich entschuldige mich schon jetzt einmal für die Puns die hier vorkommen werden…

[quote]Titel: Hitomebore
    Entwickler: FreakilyCharming
    Genre: School, Romance, Drama, Monster Girl
    Länge: 2-10 Stunden
    Premiere: 02.02.2014 Japanisch / 19.05.2015 Englisch

    Story:
    After falling in love at first sight with the shy Sachi Usui, an injury-ridden, single-eyed high school girl, the protagonist tries to win over her lonely and isolated heart. A pure, heart-warming romance game where the apple of your eye only has one eye![/quote]

[h1]Handlung:[/h1]

Die Handlung ist eigentlich eine recht typische Love Story, bis halt auf den Punkt, dass es sich bei der weiblichen Protagonistin mehr oder weniger um ein Monster Girl handelt. Bei der Geschichte sticht nichts besonders hervor und das meiste läuft trotz diesem Umstand nach Schema F ab. In der Hinsicht gibt es hier keine großen Überraschungen. Auch der (recht kleine) Dramateil wird ohne große Schwierigkeiten sehr schnell abgehandelt. Die Handlung ist zwar interessant, der Spannungsbogen wird aber recht flach gehalten. Trotzdem hat man aber Interesse hier am Ball zu bleiben und die Geschichte rund um Sachi und Mamoru weiter zu verfolgen. Hier wird definitiv nichts neues Erfunden, aber auf dem was in dem Genre sonst so Gang und gebe ist, wird solide aufgebaut.

Ich hatte zu beginn doch eher eine Handlung erwartet, welche mehr mit dem Thema Diskrimination rund um Sachi handeln wird. Dieses Thema wird allerdings nur am Rand angeschnitten und ist definitiv kein Hauptaugenmerk des Settings. Dies hat mich positiv überrascht, da sich insgesamt die Handlung doch anders entwickelt hat, als es vorher für mich ersichtlich war.

Da es sich hier um eine kinetische Visual Novel handelt, gibt es keine Entscheidungen zu treffen. Man beginnt einfach zu lesen und ehe man sich versieht, ist man auch schon am Ende angekommen. Als relativ schneller Leser war ich mit Hitomebore inklusive den Extras in unter zwei Stunden fertig.

[h1]Illustrationen:[/h1]

Die CGs und Illustrationen der Charaktere sind hier deutlich anders als in anderen Visual Novels, die ich bisher gelesen habe. Es unterscheidet sich hier doch stark von anderen Zeichenstilen. Das was man sonst so in Visual Novels zu sehen bekommt, wirkt vom Stil her hiergegen schon fast klinisch rein. Hitomebore hat einen Zeichenstil, bei dem sowohl die Hintergründe als auch die Charaktere gemalt wirken, wobei es ein eher grober Malstil ist. Ich finde nicht, dass dies mit irgendeiner anderen Visual Novel zu vergleichen ist. Hierbei muss man aber auch sagen, dass der Stil definitiv nicht für jeden etwas ist. Als jemand, der selbst kein Auge für Kunst hat, kann ich es aber auch nicht mit irgendetwas aus der Malerwelt vergleichen. Hier muss einfach jeder mal selbst ein Auge darauf werfen und entscheiden, ob man sich mit dem Stil anfreunden kann. Ich für meinen Teil habe mich zumindest mal darauf eingelassen und meiner Meinung nach passt es definitiv zu Hitomebore.

[h1]Charaktere:[/h1]

Bei den Charakteren liegt der Fokus klar auf den beiden Protagonisten Mamoru und Sachi. Hinzu kommen noch zwei Freunde von Mamoru und natürlich eine Antagonistin. Auch wenn Hitomebore relativ kurz ist, wurden die Hauptcharaktere doch befriedigend entwickelt. Allerdings nur befriedigend, da man am Ende doch immer noch offene Fragen zu den Charakteren hat und man sich doch fragt, auf welcher Basis manche Entscheidungen der Charaktere getroffen werden. Gerade was die Hintergrundgeschichte von Sachi angeht, hätte ich mir doch deutlich mehr gewünscht. Dies zieht zwar das Charakterdesign nicht wirklich herunter, ein bisschen mehr wäre hier aber doch wünschenswert gewesen. Was mir hier wohl ein wenig gefehlt hat, war bei der Produktion jemand mit einem Auge für Details, welcher die Charaktere noch etwas ausgeschmückt hätte. Bei den Nebencharakteren hätte deutlich mehr Informationen gut getan. Diese sind vom Aufbau doch deutlich schwächer als die Protagonisten. Hier hätte ich mir sogar gewünscht, dass es auch bei denen Charakterentwicklung, vielleicht sogar eine romantische Entwicklung gegeben hätte. Rin, die Antagonistin, ist die Charakterin, die am schlechtesten erklärt wird. Hier brauchte man wohl einfach nur eine Gegenspielerin. Eine Substanz steckt allerdings nicht hinter ihr, was schade ist. Meiner Meinung nach sind in Hitomebore die Charaktere doch ein leichter Schwachpunkt. Dies ist etwas, was bei einer Visual Novel, deren Fokus auf den Charakteren liegt, nicht passieren sollte.

[h1]Sound:[/h1]

Der Sound ist für mich das größte Manko. Es gibt in den Optionen zwei Schieberegler: Einen für Musik und einen für Soundeffekte. Obwohl es Schieberegler sind, funktionieren sie gefühlt doch wie Kippschalter. Entweder hört man gar nichts oder man bekommt das Trommelfell mal ordentlich durchgepustet. Ob dieses Problem überall auftritt, kann ich nicht sagen, bei mir war es zumindest unter Mac OS der Fall. Warum es überhaupt einen Schieberegler für Soundeffekte gibt, ist wieder so eine andere Sache. Gefühlt gibt es nur drei Soundeffekte in der ganzen Visual Novel. Das hätte man dann auch komplett weglassen können.

Was die Musik angeht, so konnte ich hier schon nach kurzer Zeit nichts anderes mehr, als mit den Augen zu rollen. Der Soundtrack hat mich einfach Wahnsinnig gemacht. Hier war ich dann doch froh über den “Schiebe-Kipp-Regler”. Von der Musik bin ich einfach nur aggressiv geworden. Normalerweise soll Musik ja die Ereignisse der Novel unterstützen, hier führte es aber dazu, dass ich einfach nur noch rot gesehen habe. Bei aller liebe, aber ich konnte mich absolut nicht mit der Musik anfreunden. Das ist dann aber auch mein größter Kritikpunkt an Hitomebore.

[h1]Fazit:[/h1]

Hitomebore ist vom Setting und von den Illustrationen definitiv mal etwas anderes, was sich doch in dem Bereich deutlich von anderen Titel abhebt. Leider wurde dann aber nicht das volle Potential genutzt und gerade bei den Charakteren sind doch Mankos zu spüren. Nachdem ich die Musik ausgeschaltet hatte, machte Hitomebore doch durchaus Spaß zu lesen. Da man mit der Visual Novel keine größere zeitliche Verpflichtung eingeht, kann ich trotz der Schwächen jedem mal empfehlen, einen Blick in Hitomebore zu werfen.

[h1]7/10[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198026884623', 'num_games_owned': 275, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1432193098}
review:
A short kinetic visual novel, Love at First Sight: Hitomebore is a solo project by the artist Ray-K. 
The plot is a fairly standard high school love-story/drama with an unusual character; Usui Satsi (or Sachi, as this official release has localized her name as). The story is warm for the most part, and touches on typical subjects in high school that come with being an "odd one out".

That being said, there isn't a whole lot to get out of this read if you aren't already predisposed to a few things:
A) Liking Ray-K's cute and macabre artwork.
B) Finding cyclops girls to be the most precious thing in the world (who doesn't?).
C) You don't have stupidly high expectations because you've actually read (or tried to read) more than just the popular, cream of the crop VNs (with even some of those not actually being that good).

I'll be frank, $10 is a steep price for this short read. There's nothing new or unprecedented here, just a small solo project that's well put-together for the most part. Ray-K is responsible for everything except some of the music and of course, the Ren'py engine.
However, as a fan of Ray-K's art and general curiosity after skipping through an untranslated demo he released a while back, I was pleasantly surprised to see it translated and released here. I didn't hesitate at all to purchase it.
The game actually includes some nice extras: character profiles, stages of development, and some bonus scenes, but some are left untranslated at the moment. Hopefully that will be changed in the future.
The creator, Ray-K, admits it wasn't ultimately near his original vision in an Afterword that's included, but is very satisfied he was able to make a game featuring his character, Usui Satsi.

But yeah, buy this game so you can learn to love cyclops girls if for some reason you already don't and earn some cute trading cards.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967599040', 'num_games_owned': 9931, 'num_reviews': 239, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1434081817}
review:
サークルFreakilyCharmingのノベルゲーム「ひと目惚れ」Steam版
日本語対応で、内容こそ差異はないがオリジナル版と違い立ち絵や背景絵が描き直されているみたい。
とある高校に転校してきたばかりの主人公「福永護」が、屋上の登り階段で出会った単眼の女子高生「臼井幸」に興味を持ち始める見た目・名前通りの一つ目ラブな作品。
ボリュームは数時間で読み終えられる程度。


ちくしょう・・・こいつら、高校生カップルみたいな(注：実際高校生という設定です)ベタベタな恋愛しおって！あーんとか言ってお弁当食べさせたり、手をつないでデートしおってからに！！！ドジっ子さっちゃんもかわいすぎるぞ！こっ恥ずかしい二人のやり取り見てて、おじさん羨ましくなってきたから、ちょっこし俺も屋上の登り階段で単眼の女の子見つけてきて青春を送ってくる！（ダッ）

author: {'steamid': '76561197977092120', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1432009751}
review: A cute, short story. The story is a somewhat normal high school drama. About 2-3 hours long. No paths or alternate endings. The extras include CGs, character sprites, and music. Unfortunately the text on the character profiles isn't translated (According to a comment from Sekai Project, this is coming in a future patch). There are also a few silly bonus scenes in the extras, and some history of the development as well.
